intro: Hedyotis coriacea f. conostyla, commonly known as the hairy Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its leaves are opposite and often have a leathery texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological features, including the conostyla form, which refers to its specific stem and leaf arrangement.
